page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There is no industry and local work is limited. However, unemployment is low. Those working locally are often self- employed, e.g. farmers, shopkeepers, pub landlords etc. During the survey, several people were found to be earn- ing their living from craftwork, e.g. a picture restorer, woodcarver, corn-dolly maker and a blacksmith. Some employment is available on the Bourne Estate and in Gorsley Wood, where there is a sawmill. The Burstead Manor Riding School has 19 stables, indoor riding school and outdoor fac- ilities. Horses are kept and trained and riders learn the equestrian arts. It is headquarters of the Canterbury Riding Club. There are a wide range of occupations with a small proportion of workers commuting to London, the rest travelling to Canterbury, Ashford or other places within easy reach.
